text: The Haryana government has appointed a retired IPS officer “to inquire into the acts of omission and commission by officers of both police and civil administration during the Jat quota agitation.” Prakash Singh, a former police chief of Uttar Pradesh and Assam, will submit his report within 45 days. Mr. Singh will be assisted by two serving officers of the State, each drawn from IAS and IPS cadres. — PTI
title: Role of officers under scanner
